entry.title: Coinbase, Other Crypto Exchanges Relist XRP Following Ruling in SEC v Ripple Case
entry.summary:
The Nasdaq-listed cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase has relisted XRP following a landmark ruling in the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) v. Ripple Labs case. Several other crypto exchanges have also resumed trading of XRP.
Crypto Exchanges Bring Back XRP Trading
Following the landmark ruling in the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) v. Ripple Labs case regarding XRP, multiple cryptocurrency exchanges have relisted the cryptocurrency.
The Nasdaq-listed crypto exchange Coinbase tweeted Thursday afternoon:
Our XRP-USD trading pair is now in full-trading mode on Coinbase Exchange, Coinbase Pro, and Advanced Trade. Limit, market, and stop orders are all now available.
Coinbase explained earlier: â€œOnce sufficient supply of this asset is established trading on oâ€¦

entry.title: Argentina Embraces BTC With Its First Bitcoin Futures Contract
entry.summary:
The first bitcoin futures contract just launched in Argentina, allowing investors to speculate on the future price of BTC. For crypto investors in the Latin American country, this is significant and a signal that Argentina is embracing crypto innovation. The futures contract is based on a bitcoin index provided by Matba Rofex, the largest agricultural futures & options exchange in South America.
Matba Rofex Launches Bitcoin Futures In Argentina
Back in April, Argentinaâ€™s National Securities Commission (CNV) gave Matba Rofex the go-ahead on its Bitcoin Futures after making some regulations.Â The newly introduced futures contract for BTC will be settled in Argentine pesos, and at this time, it will only be available to qualified institutional investors like investment funds or companies.â€¦

entry.title: US Court Questions Coinbase and SEC on Security, Staking in First Hearing
entry.summary: Coinbase and the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) had their first face-off today (Thursday) following the securities regulatorâ€™s charges against the cryptocurrency exchange in early June. During the pre-motion hearing, both parties argued what passes as a security and crypto staking. The debate also touched on Coinbaseâ€™s registration by SEC in 2021 and the application of the â€˜major questions doctrineâ€™ to the case. SEC vs. Coinbase SEC in its complaint against Coinbase last month claimed that the crypto exchange operates illegally as an exchange, broker and clearing agency. On Thursday, Judge Katherine Polka of the US District Court for the Southern District of New York questioned both parties on claims made by the SEC in its complaint and those by Coiâ€¦

entry.summary: Europe is on the verge of witnessing the launch of its first spot bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF). The long-awaited debut of the European spot bitcoin ETF comes after a significant delay, which has only intensified the anticipation surrounding its arrival. Coinciding with this news, the United States is also experiencing a surge of interest in a similar product, kicking off with the filing by BlackRock for an American spot bitcoin ETF. Jacob Asset Management is responsible for the ETF listing, which was actually approved in 2021. Due to market conditions in 2022, the ETF was delayed â€” although thereâ€™s no official launch date yet, the development comes at an opportune time. The ETF is designed to provide investors with an opportunity to gain exposure to bitcoin without directly owning tâ€¦

entry.title: FTC Slaps Crypto Lender Celsius With $4.7B Fine for Deceiving Consumers and Mismanaging Deposits
entry.summary:
On Thursday, following the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) suing the insolvent crypto lender Celsius, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) divulged a settlement with the firm and imposed a $4.7 billion fine for â€œduping consumers.â€ Nevertheless, the penalty will be deferred to enable Celsius to return its remaining assets to consumers in bankruptcy proceedings.
FTCâ€™s Settlement to Be â€˜Suspended to Permit Celsius to Return Its Remaining Assets to Consumers in Bankruptcy Proceedingsâ€™
The now-defunct crypto lender Celsius has incurred a fine from the FTC for allegedly hoodwinking investors and â€œsquandering billions in user deposits.â€ The company contended that it possessed â€œmore than enoughâ€ assets to safeguard customer deposits, but according to the FTC, this was a spurious clâ€¦

entry.title: CleanSpark Announces Completion Of Georgia Expansion, Surpasses 8 EH/s
entry.summary: CleanSpark Inc. has announced the completion of phase two of its mining campus expansion in Washington, Georgia. The expansion is expected to increase CleanSpark's bitcoin mining compute power by 1.8 exahashes per second (EH/s) to a total of 8.5 EH/s. The company has set lofty goals of reaching a target of 16 EH/s by the end of the year. The Washington campus has a power capacity of 50 megawatts (MW) and currently operates over 10,500 mining machines, with a total investment of over $100 million. Zach Bradford, CEO of CleanSpark, expressed his appreciation for the successful execution of the expansion, highlighting the technical expertise and support from the local community. He stated, "This expansion has already helped us get more than halfway to our year-end guidance of 16 EH/s." CleanSpark has been actively pursuing growth opportunities, particularly during the recent bear cycle. Last month, the company acquired a turnkey bitcoin mining campus in Dalton, Georgia, consisting of two sites, for $9.3 million. In addition to that, in the same month the company announced the acquisition of more than 12,000 cutting edge mining machines. The expansion in Washington, Georgia, has marked another milestone for CleanSpark as it continues to increase its bitcoin mining capacity.

entry.title: Dapper Labs Lays Off 51 Amid NFT Market Slump In Third Round Of Cuts
entry.summary:
Dapper Labs, the tech firm and non-fungible token (NFT) creator, has announced its second round of staff layoffs in less than a year. The move comes amid a more broadly challenging market environment for NFTs and cryptocurrencies.
The company behind creating the popular NFT collections, such as CryptoKitties and NBA Top Shots, has announced that it will be parting ways with 51 employees.
This latest round of staff reductions marks the third time Dapper Labs has downsized its workforce in less than a year, having already cut its staff by 20% in February 2023 and 22% in November last year.
In a note to employees, the CEO of Dapper Labs, Roham Gharegozlou, revealed that the latest round of staff reductions will affect both full-time employees and C1 contractors.
The CEOâ€™s note read:â€¦

entry.summary:
The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has filed a lawsuit against the now-defunct cryptocurrency lender, Celsius. The suit, filed Thursday, also names former CEO Alexander â€œAlexâ€ Mashinsky as a defendant. Both he and the company stand accused of falsely promising investors a safe investment with high returns.
Bankrupt Crypto Lender Celsius Accused by SEC of Misleading Investors
The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has targeted the bankrupt cryptocurrency lender, Celsius, in a lawsuit filed in New York. The SEC accuses Celsius and its former CEO of making fraudulent promises through its â€œEarn Interest Program.â€ According to the SEC, Celsius â€œmisled investors about the financial success of Celsiusâ€™s business.â€

entry.title: FTC Drops The Hammer On Celsius Network With Historic $4.7 Billion Fine
entry.summary:
The US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has reached a settlement with cryptocurrency platform Celsius Network, which has been charged with duping consumers into transferring cryptocurrency into their platform and then â€œsquanderingâ€ billions in user deposits.Â
The settlement will permanently ban Celsius from handling consumersâ€™ assets and charge three former executives with â€œtrickingâ€ consumers into transferring their cryptocurrency onto the platform by â€œfalsely promisingâ€ that deposits would be safe and always available.
Celsius Network Banned From Offering Services
According to the FTCâ€™s announcement, the settlement with Celsius and its affiliates will permanently ban the companies from offering, marketing, or promoting any product or service that could be used to deposit, exchange, iâ€¦

entry.summary: Mutiny Wallet, the first self-custodial Lightning wallet that operates on the web, has officially launched its open beta. The announcement described the walletâ€™s mission of catering to the five billion global internet users with web browser access by offering complete control of funds and eliminating the need for identity verification. Additionally, the wallet is aimed at introducing unique features that have been restricted by stringent App Store requirements in other Bitcoin wallets. The first highlighted feature of Mutiny Wallet is its integration of Lightning, a Layer 2 scaling solution built on Bitcoin. The waâ€¦
